thread.title: Lexington, Cozad medal at State Cross Country
thread.title_full: Lexington, Cozad medal at State Cross Country

author: Paul Pack C-H sports editor
title: Lexington, Cozad medal at State Cross Country
text:
Lexington, Cozad medal at State Cross Country Paul Pack C-H sports editor lexch.com | 0 comments 
KEARNEY, Neb. – The annual   were held at the Kearney Country Club Friday. 
The Lexington girls and boys teams, along with the Cozad girls team, and Riley Nichols of the Overton-Elm Creek team took part in the event. 
First up were the Class C girls, with Cozad having earned their place at the starting line by winning their District meet last week. 
On Friday Cozad didn’t have a breakout performer but ran very well as a team. Ashley Burkholder placed 19th with a time of 21:23, and three of her teammates joined her in the top 25. 
“We preached pacing and pack running, staying together.” Coach Dustin Favinger said. “They pushed the middle part of the course and did well. I am very proud of them. Phenomenal race.” 
That team-first attitude paid off with a silver medal finish for Cozad. Third place Sidnet finished a single point behind the ‘Makers. 
Boone Central/Newman Grove took the top spot with 39 points, Cozad had 55. 
In the Class C boys race, lone entry from the ECO team of Overton and Elm Creek Riley Nichols ran a strong second mile to finish in 39th out of 91 in his race. 
The Lexington girls took to the starting line at 2:30 p.m. along with the other 11 teams , and 84 racers. 
Leah Treffer paced the squad with a 35th place finish on the way to a 10th place showing for the Maids. 
Freshman McKenna Kiburz would cross the line in 22:03, Yailin Santoyo and Bianca Hernandez would finish close behind. 
The final race of the day was the Class B boys race. 
Lexington senior and district champ JohnMark Shields looked to finish strong in the last race of his high school career. 
“I’ve raced this course seven times before, and I know when I need to push and when to run steady” Shields said prior to the race. “Hergenreder of Scottsbluff is someone I will be watching for at the end.” 
Joshua Hergenreder of Scottsbluff would be looking for Shields as well, after the Lexington runner beat him at the District meet last week. 
Ultimately, Hergenreder got the best of Shields Friday, crossing the finish line two seconds earlier. Shields earned a fourth place finish. 
“I gave it my all, and while its disappointing not to finish higher, I know I did my best today, and I’m proud of how my team did.” Shields said. 
The Lexington boys finished with five runners in the top 41, taking third in the team division. 
See Wednesday’s edition of the Clipper-Herald for full results and more photos from State Cross Country. Print Posted in Local , Sports , Cozad , Lexington , Overton on Friday, October 23, 2015 6:45 pm. Updated: 7:09 pm. Similar Stories
